==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|むろ|まち|yomi=k}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=むろまち|室|tr1=muro|t1=a cellar, a certain kind of storage room|町|tr2=machi|t2=town, district}}.

===Pronunciation===
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[mu͍ɽo̞ma̠t͡ɕi]}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|むろまち}}

# the Muromachi [[district]] or area along a major street running north and south through the downtown area of [[w:Kyōto|Kyōto]]
# the north-south [[w:Muromachi Street|Muromachi Street]] in Kyōto
# the [[w:Muromachi period|Muromachi Period]] in Japan, running from approximately 1336 to 1573; so named for the government offices being located in the Muromachi area of Kyōto
# the [[w:Muromachi, Tokyo|Muromachi]] area in Nihonbashi, Tōkyō, so named for the area in Kyōto

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|street in Kyōto}} {{l|ja|室町通|tr=[[むろまちどおり]], ''[[Muromachi-dōri]]''}}
* {{sense|period in Japan}} {{l|ja|室町時代|tr=[[むろまちじだい]], ''[[Muromachi-jidai]]''}}
* {{sense|area in Tōkyō}} {{l|ja|日本橋室町|tr=[[にほんばしむろまち]], ''[[Nihonbashi Muromachi]]''}}

====Derived terms====
* {{l|ja|室町通|tr=[[むろまちどおり]], ''[[Muromachi-dōri]]''}}: [[w:Muromachi Street|Muromachi Street]]
* {{l|ja|室町時代|tr=[[むろまちじだい]], ''[[Muromachi-jidai]]''}}: the [[w:Muromachi Period|Muromachi Period]]
* {{l|ja|日本橋室町|tr=[[にほんばしむろまち]], ''[[Nihonbashi Muromachi]]''}}: the [[w:Muromachi, Tokyo|Muromachi]] area in Nihonbashi, Tōkyō
* {{l|ja|室町殿|tr=[[むろまちどの]], ''[[Muromachi-dono]]''}}: the [[palace]] of the [[Ashikaga]] [[clan]], more often called {{m|ja|花の御所|tr=[[Hana no Gosho]]||Flower Palace}} with the main gate facing Muromachi Street
* {{l|ja|室町幕府|tr=[[むろまちばくふ]], ''[[Muromachi Bakufu]]''}}: the Muromachi [[shogunate]], also called the [[w:Ashikaga shogunate|Ashikaga shogunate]]
